meanings.definition: Insufficient production of goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The underproduction of food led to shortages in the market.
meanings.sent2: The company faced losses due to underproduction of their popular product.
meanings.sent3: The underproduction of toys made the children sad during the holiday season.
meanings.sent4: Her underproduction of ideas left her feeling creatively drained.
meanings.sent5: The underproduction of oxygen in the room made it hard to breathe.

meanings.definition: The act or process of producing less than is needed or desired.
meanings.sent1: The underproduction of cars caused delays in transportation.
meanings.sent2: The underproduction of books resulted in long waiting lists at the library.
meanings.sent3: The underproduction of jokes at the party made everyone yawn.
meanings.sent4: His underproduction of effort in the project was noticeable to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The underproduction of sunlight in the room made it feel gloomy.
